meanings.sent1: The doilt in the class always made everyone laugh with their silly jokes.
meanings.sent2: Don't be a doilt and listen to your parents' advice.
meanings.sent3: The doilt tried to juggle eggs, but they ended up all over the floor.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a doilt standing in the middle of the busy street, lost and confused.
meanings.sent5: The doilt's antics at the party were unforgettable.

meanings.definition: To act foolishly or in a silly manner.
meanings.sent1: Please don't doilt around and focus on your work.
meanings.sent2: He tends to doilt when he's nervous, making silly faces to lighten the mood.
meanings.sent3: The children doilted around the playground, pretending to be superheroes.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she was doilting on thin ice, taking unnecessary risks.
meanings.sent5: The comedian loved to doilt on stage, making everyone laugh with his silly antics.
